meanings.definition: To occur or exist later in time than something else.
meanings.sent1: The invention of smartphones postdates the invention of the telephone.
meanings.sent2: My birthday postdates my sister's birthday by two weeks.
meanings.sent3: It's like my alarm clock postdates my actual waking up time!
meanings.sent4: The completion of the project postdates the deadline, causing stress.
meanings.sent5: The sunset postdates the end of the outdoor party, casting a warm glow.

meanings.definition: To assign a date later than the actual date.
meanings.sent1: The historian accidentally postdates the ancient artifact by a century.
meanings.sent2: I will postdates the meeting on the calendar to avoid conflicts.
meanings.sent3: Oops, I postdated the check, making it seem like I'm from the future!
meanings.sent4: The letter was postdated to give the impression of timeliness.
meanings.sent5: The signature on the painting was postdated to confuse art historians.

meanings.definition: To be later in time than something else.
meanings.sent1: The final exam postdates all other tests in the semester.
meanings.sent2: Her graduation postdates her sister's by a year.
meanings.sent3: The dessert postdates the main course, making it a sweet surprise.
meanings.sent4: The new model of the car postdates the previous one, offering more features.
meanings.sent5: The discovery of the new species postdates the expedition, adding excitement to the journey.
